intro: Homalocenchrus grandiflorus, commonly known as the large-flowered homalocenchrus, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows as a shrub or perennial herb, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its showy yellow or orange flowers bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is adapted to survive in harsh environments, with deep root systems and water-storing tissues.
